intro: Agapetes wardii var. heterotricha, commonly known as the variable silverleaf agapete, is a species native to the cloud forests of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a silvery or whitish pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found at high elevations. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
